intro: Renzorchis pseudoplatycoryne, commonly known as the broad-lobed orchid, is a rare and specialized orchid species native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its unique, broad-lobed leaves and intricate, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The plant thrives in cool, humid environments with well-drained soil, often found in shaded forest understories. Its reproductive system relies on specific mycorrhizal fungi for nutrient uptake, highlighting its ecological interdependence. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
